business.headline: Who is Tuhin Kanta Pandey? A look at his key roles in the governmentThe Appointments Committee of the Cabinet (ACC) has approved Tuhin Kanta Pandey's appointment for a term of three years. He is a 1987-batch Indian Administrative Service (IAS) officer from the Odisha cadre.

Tuhin Kanta Pandey appointed new Sebi Chairman, to succeed Madhabi Puri BuchTuhin Kanta Pandey, the current Finance Secretary, has been appointed as the new Chairman of market regulator Sebi. He will succeed Madhabi Puri Buch.

Amazon India hit with $39 million penalty for apparel trademark violationThe lawsuit was filed by Lifestyle Equities, the owner of the Beverly Hills Polo Club (BHPC) horse trademark. It claimed that Amazon India was selling apparel with a similar logo at lower prices.

Fixed vs floating interest rates: Which option to choose?Floating home loan interest rates are usually lower than fixed rates. Hence, they are more appealing when rates are likely to dip or stay stable.
Sensex, Nifty end flat despite banking and financial sector boostThe S&P BSE Sensex added 10.31 points to close at 74,612.43, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 2.50 points to end at 22,545.05.
Sensex, Nifty end flat despite banking and financial sector boostThe S&P BSE Sensex added 10.31 points to close at 74,612.43, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 2.50 points to end at 22,545.05.
Why NPS should be a part of your retirement plan? 5 things to knowWhen compared to fixed deposits (FDs) and Public Provident Funds (PPF), NPS offers superior returns over the long run.

Explained: Why NBFC stocks may offer stability in choppy marketsThe RBI's decision to ease certain loan rules and delay stricter regulations on capital requirements has improved sentiment in the financial sector. This has made NBFC stocks attractive options for investors.

Bitcoin sees 10% drop this week: 5 reasons behind the fallThe largest crypto has witnessed a decline of more than 10% over the last seven days. This downward trend comes amid US President Donald Trump's aggressive trade policies and EU tariff threats.

Government seeks to cut states' share of central taxes: ReportBased on the expected tax collections for the ongoing financial year, a 1% swing in the states' share of tax revenue could give the central government about Rs 3,500 crore.

Sensex, Nifty tumble 4% this month: Should share market investors be worried? Brokerage firm Emkay Global said falling prices make market investors nervous, but there are good signs too. The RBI lowering risk for NBFCs and micro-borrowers helps, and Nifty is now priced better at around 22,500.
Infosys trainees complain to PM's Office over 'forceful' layoffs: ReportThe employees have sought intervention to be reinstated in their jobs and to prevent similar terminations in the future.

entertainment.headline: Composer Pritam thanks Mumbai Police for arresting studio theft culpritMusic composer Pritam expressed gratitude towards the Mumbai Police for capturing the suspect involved in a Rs 40 lakh theft from his studio. He praised their efforts in a heartfelt Instagram post.

The Boys 5: Supernatural actors Jensen Ackles, Jared Padalecki to reuniteThe Boys Season 5 will be an exciting reunion as Soldier Boy Jensen Ackles will be joined by his Supernatural co-stars Jared Padalecki and Misha Collins.

Suits LA review: Sass, swag and secrets in a soggy spin-offReleased-Mon Feb 24, 2025'Suits LA' has the flavour of the original 'Suits', but Teddy Black is no Harvey Spector, and you will be reminded of it, despite all the pizazz in the show.

Oscar-nominated Savan Kotecha to find India's first global boy bandSavan Kotecha is launching a nationwide hunt for India's first global boy band. Partnering with Universal Music, he aims to build a teen pop economy and create Indian stars for the world stage.

Undercover High School review: Korean 'Main Hoon Na' with more thrillsReleased-Fri Feb 21, 2025Undercover High School review: It is a thrilling Korean series blending action and comedy, reminiscent of 'Main Hoon Na', where a disgraced spy navigates high school challenges while on a mission to find missing gold.

O Saathi Re: Imtiaz Ali's Netflix series is a modern story with a vintage heartNetflix has released the first look of its new series O Saathi Re, starring Avinash Tiwary, Aditi Rao Hydari, and Arjun Rampal. The series, directed by Arif Ali, will be an 'ode to vintage love in modern times'.

Prajakta Koli hilariously dances to 'Mere Husband Mujhko Piyar…' at sangeet. WatchPrajakta Koli danced to Mere Husband Mujhko Piyar Nahin Karte at her sangeet, leaving guests in splits. She married Vrishank Khanal in Karjat on February 25.

Vijay Yesudas reacts to fake news about father Yesudas's hospitalisationReports were rife that playback singer Yesudas was hospitalised in Chennai due to age-related illness. His son and playback singer Vijay Yesudas exclusively spoke to India Today and shut down the rumours.

Sex Education actor Alexander Westwood jailed for 15 years for sex offencesSex Education actor Alexander Westwood received a 15-year prison sentence for multiple sex offenses. The case has captured widespread media attention due to Westwood's role in the popular Netflix show.

Aashram 3 Part 1 ending explained: Will Pammi's revenge end Baba Nirala's reign?With Aashram Season 3 Part 2 releasing on February 27, let us take a look at how the season ended on a cliffhanger with Baba Nirala's misuse of power and a change in dynamics.

Amit Trivedi says Jasleen Royal's opening act for Coldplay was 'unfortunate'Amit Trivedi, in an interview with India Today Digital, discussed the controversy over Jasleen Royal's opening act for Coldplay's India tour and whether it would impact on the image of Indian artists.

Rapper Kanye West trying to save marriage with Bianca Censori: ReportKanye West is reportedly trying to prevent his marriage with Bianca Censori from ending. An insider reveals that Bianca is considering divorce, and Kanye is panicking.

general news.headline: Man accused of raping woman inside bus at Pune depot arrested after 2-day manhuntDattatray Ramdas Gade, accused of raping a 26-year-old woman inside a bus at Pune's Swargate depot, was arrested in Shirur, where he was hiding at a farm.

Likely unlawful: Judge blocks Donald Trump's call for mass firings by US agenciesA federal judge in San Francisco on Thursday found that the mass firings of probationary employees were likely unlawful.

Who is Tuhin Kanta Pandey? A look at his key roles in the governmentThe Appointments Committee of the Cabinet (ACC) has approved Tuhin Kanta Pandey's appointment for a term of three years. He is a 1987-batch Indian Administrative Service (IAS) officer from the Odisha cadre.

What's the need to learn Hindi? DMK's Kanimozhi on three-language policy rowDMK leader Kanimozhi opposed the three-language policy, questioning Hindi's necessity in Tamil Nadu and accusing the Centre of withholding funds meant for the state.

To let Shashi Tharoor be or not to be; the Shakespearean dilemma of CongressA part of Shashi Tharoor's problem is that he can't be slotted easily into any 'camp', a public intellectual who is perhaps far more comfortable in the rarefied environs of a literature festival than in the cabals and coteries of Congress politics.

28 stitches on private parts: Girl, 5, battles for life after rape in GwaliorThe 5-year-old girl was hospitalised with extensive wounds, and her private parts sustained severe damage. She underwent major surgery, which required 28 stitches to her genital area.

Singer Katy Perry to go to space with 2 journalists aboard Jeff Bezos' spacecraftSinger Katy Perry will join Blue Origin's historic NS-31 mission in spring 2025, marking the first all-female astronaut crew since 1963. Led by Lauren Sanchez, the team includes influential figures from media, activism, and science.

Israel says it 'failed to protect civilians' during October 7 Hamas attackOn October 7, 2023, the Palestinian militant group Hamas stormed southern Israel, killing 1,200 people and taking more than 250 hostages, which led to a full-blown war in Gaza.

Bihar is f***** up: Teacher suspended over viral abusive rant on job postingThe expletives-laden videos against Bihar and its people has sparked backlash and Kendriya Vidyalaya has suspended the teacher.

Lahore rain and Australia threaten Afghanistan's historic semi-final bidAfghanistan once again meet Australia in a high-octane match at an ICC event. This time, Australia stand in their way of reaching the semi-final of the Champions Trophy. Apart from Australia, Afghanistan will also be fighting fate, as inclement weather threatens to spoil their run in the tournament.

Earthquake of magnitude 6.1 strikes Nepal, tremors felt in BiharResidents in Patna experienced strong tremors after a 6.1-magnitude earthquake struck Nepal's Sindhupalchok district early Friday. No damage or casualties have been reported so far.

Seven planets visible in the sky: It won't happen again for over a decadeThe planets — Mercury, Venus, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune — will appear in a curved line across the sky, known as the ecliptic, which is the path the Sun traces.

Gene Hackman and wife's death mystery: Here are theories swirling aroundThough the primary investigation ruled out any foul play, the simultaneous deaths of actor Gene Hackman, his wife, and their dog sparked widespread speculation about the cause of their sudden death.

Pakistan cricket's miserable state: Prime Minister to take notice, says advisorChampions Trophy 2025: Pakistan getting knocked out of the ICC tournament is set to have some ramifications. Rana Sanaullah, advisor to Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif, has said that the PM will take notice of this embarrassing loss.

Tuhin Kanta Pandey appointed new Sebi Chairman, to succeed Madhabi Puri BuchTuhin Kanta Pandey, the current Finance Secretary, has been appointed as the new Chairman of market regulator Sebi. He will succeed Madhabi Puri Buch.

Laureus withdraws Sinner's Sportsman of the Year nomination over doping banThe Laureus Academy has withdrawn World No.1 tennis player Jannik Sinner's nomination for this year's Sportsman of the Year award. The Academy let its decision known via a press release on Thursday, February 27.

Will Modi's high-risk gambit with Trump pay off?Experts say US president Donald Trump's punitive actions are a wake-up call for India to liberalise its trade policy to cash in on the emerging global economic order

Uniform Civil Code protects rights of women in live-in relationships: High CourtThe Uttarakhand High Court, while hearing petitions challenging the State's Uniform Civil Code mandating the registration of live-in relationships, observed that the law seeks to balance societal acceptance of such unions with the protection of women's and children's rights.

Amitabh Bachchan addresses his cryptic 'time to go' post and retirement rumoursAmitabh Bachchan's 'Time to go' post on X fuelled rumours about his retirement. In the latest episode of Kaun Banega Crorepati, he explained his intention behind the viral post.

DY Chandrachud recalls Nirbhaya case: 'Implementing laws for women important'Proper implementation of laws made for women is required to prevent incidents of sexual harassment, the former CJI said, adding a lot of changes were made in laws following the Nirbhaya incident in Delhi.

Pakistani woman's 'divorced, desi, thriving' dance video comes with a powerful messageA text overlay on the viral video read: "You found the perfect song to dance to as a recently divorced Pakistani mother of three."

Beyond words: How Nara Lokesh turned adversity into actionAndhra Pradesh IT Minister Nara Lokesh faced his toughest test when his father, Chandrababu Naidu, was jailed in 2023. Rather than retreat, Lokesh fought back. He challenged the arrest, rallied support, and proved his resilience in a defining political moment.

Punjab, Haryana wheat not liked to hair loss in Maharashtra's Buldhana: FarmersHealth experts and farmer leaders have rejected claims by Dr Himmatrao Bawaskar linking Punjab wheat to sudden hair loss in Maharashtra's Buldhana district, calling it an attempt to defame the border state.

Stay within party discipline: Abhishek Banerjee's warning to Trinamool workers Abhishek Banerjee urged Trinamool Congress workers to remain disciplined, setting aside personal interests, and work tirelessly to secure over 215 seats in the 2026 Assembly elections.

Amitabh Bachchan addresses his cryptic 'time to go' post and retirement rumoursAmitabh Bachchan's 'Time to go' post on X fuelled rumours about his retirement. In the latest episode of Kaun Banega Crorepati, he explained his intention behind the viral post.

Read Ayushmann Khurrana's letter to his younger self who 'dared to dream'Bollywood star Ayushmann Khurrana shared a sweet and touching letter to his younger self as his acclaimed movie, Dum Laga Ke Haisha, turned 10. The movie also starred Bhumi Pednekar.

Abhishek Banerjee, Shahana Goswami, Neeraj Kabi lead Bharat Bala's 'Mahasangam''Mahasangam', directed by Bharat Bala, features Abhishek Banerjee, Shahana Goswami, and Neeraj Kabi in a story set against the Maha Kumbh festival. It explores the dynamics of a musical inheritance within a family.

Zoya Akhtar and her team on bringing magic of cinema with 'Superboys of Malegaon'Filmmaker Zoya Akhtar and Reema Kagti talk about bringing 'Superboys of Malegaon', their latest film about the joy of filmmaking and making dreams come true, irrespective of the sources. The team of the film, including actors Vineet Kumar Singh, Adarsh Gourav and Shashank Arora, explain why this is a beautiful attempt at making honest cinema. While Ritesh Sidhwani talks about finding the real parameters for success when box office numbers tell a pretty lopsided story, director Kagti breaks down a prominent scene from the film.

sports.headline: Watch: MS Dhoni and R Ashwin reunited as CSK amp up IPL 2025 preparationsCSK fans were given a dose of nostalgia by the franchise as MS Dhoni and R Ashwin reunited during the training camp ahead of the IPL 2025 campaign. Ashwin returned to the franchise after a gap of 7 years.

Ashleigh Gardner's all-round show hands RCB third successive defeat in BangaloreGujarat Giants beat Royal Challengers Bengaluru by six wickets in Match 12 of the Women's Premier League 2025 (WPL 2025). Gujarat captain Ashleigh Gardner was adjudged Player of the Match for her match-winning half-century.

AFG vs AUS Lahore weather forecast: Will rain wash out Afghanistan's hopes?Afghanistan and Australia are all set to lock horns in a crucial clash in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 on Friday, February 28 at Gaddafi Stadium, Lahore. However, there are dark clouds hovering over the match with heavy chances of rain during the fixture.

Butcher slams 'arrogant' England team: Everybody wants to see them loseFormer England players Mark Butcher and Alex Hartley have slammed the arrogance of the England side. Butcher has claimed that everyone wants to see England lose because of the team's arrogance on and off the field.

India's advantage in Dubai puts more pressure on them: Rassie van der DussenSouth Africa batter Rassie van der Dussen said that India would be under more pressure in the knockout stages of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 to make the most of their advantage in Dubai.

Afghanistan vs Australia, all you need to know: Lahore pitch report, live streamingAfghanistan and Australia will face-off in one of the most anticipated fixtures of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 on Friday, February 28 at Gaddafi Stadium in Lahore. The winner of the fixture will qualify for the semi-finals of the tournament.

Champions Trophy: Which is the 2nd best ODI team in Asia?Two Asian teams - Bangladesh and Pakistan, have already been knocked out of the Champions Trophy 2025. Are the Asian ODI teams in decline? If India is the best ODI team in the continent, who is the second best? Kingshuk and Rishabh discuss in the Clash of Champions.

Asia Cup 2025 in September, likely to be played at a neutral venue in T20 formatThe 17th edition of the Asia Cup is likely to be played in T20 format. UAE is set to host the tournament as the Asian Cricket Council is keen on picking a neutral venue for the continental tournament.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
